text:
November 28, 1956
Mr, Donald S. Nash
425 Rugby Avenue
Rochester 11, New York
Dear Mr. Nash*
In answer to your request of November 14, we would like to give you in¬
formation regarding membership in the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters.
The NAEB has categories of membership as followsi
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or TV stations.
Associate Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over a
comercial outlet.
Affiliate - Organizations interested in the general furtherance of educa¬
tional broadcasting.
Individual - All pe sons interested in or seeking to proioote educational,
cultural and public service broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the Association are based
on rated transmitter power as follows*
Class A - 5 kw and over $50.00
Class B - 1 to 4.9 kw 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50 and those with 5 kw
or more video power pay $100.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10 a year; Individual members pay $5.
For this fee members receive our monthly New sletter; the NAK3 Journal (formerly
the AKRT Journal): the various reports and surveys we publish periodically! ■
services of our Ilaceraent Service
ment consultant*
acement Service, television^engineer, legal-counsel, manage
stc; plus the normal lay to dajrservices, information, and
